tuning_runs.description: Initial config - NM maxiter=40/50 was WAY too expensive
tuning_runs.notes: ABORTED - 2-source samples taking 500+ seconds each. NM on fine grid is too expensive. Killed at 34/80 samples.

tuning_runs.description: Reduced NM budget - maxiter 8/12, top_n=2, but still on FINE grid
tuning_runs.notes: EXCELLENT score (+0.0192 vs baseline) but 2x over time budget. NM on fine grid still too expensive even with reduced iterations.

tuning_runs.description: NM on COARSE grid - saved 18 min but still over budget
tuning_runs.notes: Good score (+0.0084 vs baseline) but still 48 min over budget. Coarse NM helped but not enough. Score dropped vs Run 2 due to less precise NM.

tuning_runs.description: Minimal NM - top_n=1, maxiter=3/5 on coarse grid
tuning_runs.notes: IN BUDGET but score dropped BELOW baseline (1.1247). Minimal NM doesn't help enough. 64/80 samples used NM, 2/80 fallback. The trade-off doesn't work: reducing CMA-ES to fit NM hurts more than NM helps.

best_in_budget.notes: BELOW baseline. Score 1.1132 vs baseline 1.1247 = -0.0115 worse

best_overall.notes: Best score achieved but 2x over time budget

conclusion: FAILED - Sequential handoff fundamentally doesn't work within budget. NM improves accuracy when given time (Run 2: +0.0192) but the time overhead is prohibitive. When reduced enough to fit budget (Run 4), the score drops below baseline. There is no configuration that beats baseline within the 60-min budget.
